column5: My brothers and I will be fishing northern ontario during mid august and obviously want to do well. Where will the walleye's and pike be and what techniques should be hot at that time (jigging, trolling, casting)???

Jigging always works well in the mid-summer when fishing reefs and points with deep drop offs. Pulling spinners and lindy rigs along the outside of weedbeds on cloudy days works well. Also, long lining reefs with a naked hook and leech (or minnow) is very effective. Don't bet on hot weather in northern Ontario in mid-August. Come prepared with shorts, sun screen and your winter coat. TGG
